paper_id: Balance of potassium in two long-term field experiments with different fertilization treatments

paper_metadata.title: Balance of potassium in two long-term field experiments with different fertilization treatments
paper_metadata.primary_focus: Potassium balance and dynamics in long-term field experiments under different fertilization treatments

research_methodology.experimental_design: Long-term stationary field experiments with 6 fertilization treatments and a 3-crop rotation, with all crops grown annually.

temporal_scope.data_collection_frequency: Annually for yields and plant K content; specific soil samples taken at experiment establishment (1996) and end of 7th crop rotation (2017).
temporal_scope.seasonal_coverage: Autumn (organic/mineral P/K application), Spring (mineral N application).
monitoring_timeline: 2017: End of 7th crop rotation, final soil sampling, plant harvest

spatial_scope.regional_representativeness: Corresponds to intensive farming systems used in the Czech Republic

sample_design.randomization_approach: Not explicitly stated, but implied by 'trials were established'
controls_and_treatments: 3: Half dose of farmyard manure + nitrogen (N) in mineral nitrogen fertilizers (FYM 1/2)
6: Straw of spring barley + N in mineral nitrogen fertilizers (N + ST)

measurement_protocols: Plant K content: Dry decomposition (Mader et al. 1998), Atomic Adsorption Spectrometry (AA280FS, Agilent Technologies)
Soil K content (bioavailable): CaCl2/DTPA (CAT) extraction (CSN EN 13651, 2001), measured by ICP-OES (Agilent Technologies 700)
Soil K content (Mehlich 3): Mehlich 3 extraction (Mehlich 1984), measured by ICP-OES
Soil K content (exchangeable Kex): Ammonium acetate (NH4OAc) extraction (modified Haby et al. 1990), measured by ICP-OES
Soil K content (non-exchangeable Kne): Boiling HNO3 extraction (Helmke and Sparks 2000), calculated by subtracting NH4OAc-determined K from HNO3 values, measured by ICP-OES
instrumentation: Atomic Adsorption Spectrometry (AA280FS, Agilent Technologies, Mulgrave, Australia)
Optical Emission Spectrometer with Inductive Coupled Plasma (ICP-OES, Agilent Technologies 700, Victoria, Australia)
quality_control: Standardized extraction methods (e.g., CSN EN 13651, Mehlich 1984, Haby et al. 1990, Helmke and Sparks 2000)

statistical_approach.significance_testing: Not explicitly stated p-value threshold, but 'significant differences' are reported.
statistical_approach.uncertainty_quantification: Not explicitly stated (e.g., standard errors or confidence intervals for all reported means)

primary_measurements.parameter: K recovery rate from farmyard manure by crops
K recovery rate from mineral fertilizers by crops

primary_measurements.measurement_context: Luvisol site (Hněvčeves), where changes were recorded
Cambisol site (Humpolec), where no changes were recorded

primary_measurements.parameter: Maximum negative K balance over 21 years
primary_measurements.measurement_context: Mineral nitrogen fertilization treatment at Humpolec site

primary_measurements.parameter: Average K uptake by plants (Humpolec vs Hněvčeves)
primary_measurements.measurement_context: Higher at Humpolec site on average for all variants over 21 years

variables: Content of exchangeable K in soil

temporal_patterns.trend_description: Changes recorded only at the Luvisol site (Hněvčeves), but not at the Cambisol site (Humpolec).

comparative_results.statistical_significance: Significantly greater differences obtained in K content in straw and potato tubers
comparative_results.practical_significance: Higher K uptake by plants at Humpolec despite lower bioavailable K in soil, possibly due to higher potato yield and better precipitation distribution.

comparative_results.comparison_type: Fertilization treatment effects on K balance
comparative_results.practical_significance: Positive K balance only at FYM 1 treatment. Highest negative balance at mineral N fertilization. Negative balance also for NPK fertilization and N + St.

geographic_details.elevation: Hněvčeves: 265 m a.s.l.; Humpolec: 525 m a.s.l.

climate_characteristics.climate_classification: Not explicitly stated, but characterized by temperature and precipitation

precipitation_patterns.distribution_Humpolec: Regular distribution throughout the vegetation period

climate_characteristics.growing_season: Not explicitly defined, but implied by crop rotation

soil_properties.soil_classification: Hněvčeves: Haplic Luvisol on loess; Humpolec: Stagnic Cambisol on loess on paragneiss
soil_properties.texture: Hněvčeves: Clay loam (Clay 4.4%, Silt 77.0%, Sand 18.7%); Humpolec: Sandy loam (Clay 5.8%, Silt 43.6%, Sand 50.6%)
soil_properties.mineralogy: Not explicitly stated, but 2:1 clay minerals (mica, vermiculite) are mentioned in relation to non-exchangeable K binding.

rates.total_N_3_year_cycle: 330 kg N/ha (for FYM 1, FYM 1/2, N, NPK, N+St treatments)
rates.mineral_N_wheat: 140 kg N/ha (N, NPK, N+St); 115 kg N/ha (FYM 1/2)
rates.mineral_N_barley: 70 kg N/ha (N, NPK, N+St); 50 kg N/ha (FYM 1/2)
rates.FYM_1_average_fresh_dose_Hnevceves: 63.0 t/ha/3 years (13.4 t dry mass/ha/3 years; 2.462% N in dry mass)
rates.FYM_1_average_fresh_dose_Humpolec: 59.45 t/ha/3 years (13.42 t dry mass/ha/3 years; 2.459% N in dry mass)

timing: Organic fertilizers (FYM, straw): Autumn (October) to potatoes
Mineral phosphorus and potassium fertilizers: Autumn to each crop
Mineral nitrogen fertilizers: Spring prior to crop establishment for potatoes and spring barley
Mineral nitrogen fertilizers (winter wheat): Divided into halves, first at BBCH 21, second at BBCH 31–32

data_collection_schedule: Yield and plant K content: Annually
study_timeline.monitoring_frequency: Annual for crop-related data, specific points for soil data

long_term_trends.sustainability_implications: Different fertilization intensities manifested by significant differences in the content of exchangeable K in soil.

long_term_trends.trend_direction: Changes recorded at Luvisol site (Hněvčeves), no changes at Cambisol site (Humpolec)
long_term_trends.sustainability_implications: Determining non-exchangeable K enables a complex view of the potassium issue, especially at insufficient K fertilization (risk management) and resulting K deficit in agricultural soils.

long_term_trends.trend_direction: Negative for most treatments over 21 years, positive only for FYM 1
long_term_trends.sustainability_implications: Annual potassium doses in mineral fertilizers for more than 20 years have been only 5–6 kg K/ha agricultural soil, leading to K deficit.

spatial_variability.site_differences: Significant differences in soil properties, climate, yields, and K dynamics between Hněvčeves and Humpolec.

methodological_strengths: Long-term study (21 years) providing insights into long-term K dynamics.
Two distinct sites with different soil and climatic conditions enhance generalizability.
Comprehensive set of K extraction methods (Mehlich 3, NH4OAc, boiling HNO3, CaCl2/DTPA) provides a holistic view of soil K pools.
Detailed tracking of K inputs (fertilizers, manure, straw) and outputs (crop uptake) for robust balance calculations.
Replication of plots (4 replications for soil samples) supports statistical analysis.
methodological_limitations: Soil samples for the end of the experiment (2017) were only taken from plots with spring barley, potentially limiting representativeness for other crops in the rotation.
Specific replication levels for plant samples and yield data are not explicitly stated.
Exact p-values or confidence intervals for all reported statistical differences are not provided in the text.
data_quality_assessment.data_completeness: High for K balance, soil K content, crop yields, and fertilization rates.
data_quality_assessment.measurement_precision: Not explicitly quantified (e.g., coefficient of variation for analytical methods or field measurements).

representativeness.spatial_representativeness: Good, with two sites representing different soil-climatic conditions within the Czech Republic.
representativeness.temporal_representativeness: Excellent, due to the 21-year duration, allowing for assessment of long-term trends.
representativeness.system_representativeness: Good, as the crop rotation and farming systems correspond to intensive farming practices in the Czech Republic.

uncertainty_sources: Inherent variability in field experiments (soil heterogeneity, weather fluctuations).
Potential for sampling bias if soil samples from only spring barley plots are not fully representative of the entire rotation's impact.
validation_evidence: Findings are discussed in context of previous research (e.g., Blake et al. 1999 on K utilization and sorption capacity).

key_methodological_references: Blake et al. (1999) - 1 mol/L ammonium acetate solution for Kex
Hinsinger and Jaillard (1993) - Plant absorption of non-exchangeable K
Steingrobe and Claasen (2000) - H+ excretion in rhizosphere
Srinivasarao et al. (2014) - Boiling HNO3 extraction for Kne
Liu and Bates (1990) - Non-exchangeable K as plant-available K indicator
Brouder (2011) - Non-exchangeable K binding to clay minerals
Mader et al. (1998) - Dry decomposition for plant analysis
Haby et al. (1990) - Modified ammonium acetate extraction
Helmke and Sparks (2000) - Boiling HNO3 extraction
Černý et al. (2010) - Details on treatments
comparative_studies: Blake et al. (1999) on K utilization and sorption capacity, supporting the finding of higher K utilization in soils with higher sorption capacity.
literature_integration.theoretical_framework: The study operates within the framework of soil potassium dynamics, including exchangeable K, non-exchangeable K, plant uptake, and the influence of fertilization on K balance and soil K pools.

extraction_metadata.data_richness_assessment: High, the paper provides extensive quantitative data on K inputs, outputs, balances, soil properties, and crop performance across different treatments and sites.
potential_ambiguities: Exact replication numbers for plant yield and K content measurements are not explicitly stated, only for soil samples.
Specific p-values for all 'significant differences' are not provided in the text.
extraction_limitations: The provided 'Table Data' was not in a directly parseable format, so all numerical data were extracted from the main text and abstract only.
recommended_validation_checks: Review of the original paper's tables for additional numerical precision or context not explicitly stated in the text.

results.paper_id: Balance of potassium in two long-term field experiments with different fertilization treatments.pdf
